data.title: One split
data.statement:
You have to split a text [[t]] by the <<first>> occurrence of the [[match]] (case sensitive).

Return a tuple with three elements:
1 - everything before the "match"
2 - the "match"
3 - everything after the "match"

Example:
t = "I love coding and I love apples"
match = "love"

Output should be: 
`I
love
 coding and I love apples`

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
I love coding and I love apples
love
testCases.testOut:
I 
love
 coding and I love apples

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
I love coding and I love bananas
love
testCases.testOut:
I 
love
 coding and I love bananas

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testIn:
I love you, you love me?
you
testCases.testOut:
I love 
you
, you love me?

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
I love you, do you?
you

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn:
This one is not tricky
i
testCases.testOut:
Th
i
s one is not tricky

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
That one is not tricky!
i
testCases.testOut:
That one 
i
s not tricky!

testCases.title: Test 5
testCases.testIn:
I'm the only one here
y
testCases.testOut:
I'm the onl
y
 one here

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
He's the only one here
y
testCases.testOut:
He's the onl
y
 one here

data.stubGenerator:
read t:string(256)
read match:string(20)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> The text [[t]] to be splitted
<<Line 2 :>> The string [[match]] to be used to split [[t]]
data.outputDescription:
Print out the following elements in 3 different lines:
1 - everything before the "match"
2 - the "match"
3 - everything after the "match"

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to split a text t by the first occurrence of the match (case sensitive).

Return a tuple with three elements:
1 - everything before the "match"
2 - the "match"
3 - everything after the "match"

Example:
t = "I love coding and I love apples"
match = "love"

Output should be: 
I
love
 coding and I love apples
Input
Line 1 : The text t to be splitted
Line 2 : The string match to be used to split t
Output
Print out the following elements in 3 different lines:
1 - everything before the "match"
2 - the "match"
3 - everything after the "match"
Constraints
The match always exists in t
Example
Input
I love coding and I love apples
love
Output
I 
love
 coding and I love apples
